refnamediv.refpurpose: a class that can check if a formula is an invariant of an mCRL2 LPE

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The class &class_invariant_checker; uses an instance of the class &class_bdd_prover; to check whether a formula is a valid invariant of an mCRL2 LPE. The constructor &invariant_checker_constructor; initializes the BDD based prover with the parameters &par_rewrite_strategy; and &par_time_limit;, and with the data specification of the LPE passed as parameter &par_lpe;. If the parameter &par_counter_example; is set, a so called counter example will be printed to &stderr; when a summand is encountered that violates the invariant. A counter example is a valuation for which the formula to be proven does not hold. If the parameter &par_all; is set, the invariant checker will not stop as soon as a violation of the invariant is found, but will report all violations instead. The function &invariant_checker_check_invariant; indicates whether the invariant passed as parameter &par_invariant; is an invariant of the given LPE.

Given an LPE,
P(d: D) = ... + sum ei: Ei. ci(d, ei) -> ai(fi(d, ei)) . P(gi(d, ei)) + ...;
an instance of the class &class_invariant_checker; will generate a formula of the form
inv(d) /\ ci(d, ei) => inv(gi(d, ei))
for each of the summands, where inv() is the formula passed as parameter &par_invariant;. If the invariant holds for the initial state and all the generated formulas are tautologies according to the prover, the formula passed as parameter &par_invariant; is an invariant.

refsect1.title: Preconditions
refsect1.para:
The following precondition has to be satisfied for &invariant_checker_constructor;:
the parameter &par_lpe; is a valid mCRL2 LPE

The following precondition has to be satisfied for &invariant_checker_check_invariant;:
the parameter &par_invariant; is a valid formula in internal mCRL2 format
